00042 unsigned char device_id;
00043 
00045 unsigned int counter_compare0 = 0;
00047 unsigned int counter_sync=0;
00049 unsigned int counter_ping_interval=0;
00050 
00054 void bus_parse_message(void) {
00055         BUS_MESSAGE bus_message = rx_queue_get();
00056 
00057         if (bus_message.cmd == BUS_CMD_ACK)
00058                 bus_message_acked(bus_message.from_addr);
00059         else if (bus_message.cmd == BUS_CMD_NACK)
00060                 bus_message_nacked(bus_message.from_addr, bus_message.data[0]);
00061         else {
00062         
00063         }
00064         
00065         //Drop the message
00066         rx_queue_drop();
00067 }
00068 
00072 unsigned char read_ext_addr(void) {
00073         return(~(PINE >> 2) & 0x0F);
00074 }
00075 
00077 int main(void)
00078 {
00079         cli();
00080         
00081         delay_ms(250);
00082 
00083         init_ports();
00084 
00085         delay_ms(250);
00086 
00087         /* Initialize various hardware resources */
00088 
00089         /* Read the external address of the device */
00090         bus_set_address(BUS_BASE_ADDR+read_ext_addr());
00091 
00092         /* This delay is simply so that if you have the devices connected to the same power supply
00093         all units should not send their status messages at the same time. Therefor we insert a delay
00094         that is based on the external address of the device */
00095         for (unsigned char i=0;i<bus_get_address();i++)
00096                 delay_ms(DEFAULT_STARTUP_DELAY);
00097 
00098         //Initialize the communication bus      
00099         bus_init();
00100         
00101         if ((BUS_BASE_ADDR+read_ext_addr()) == 0x01)
00102                 bus_set_is_master(1,DEF_NR_DEVICES);
00103         else
00104                 bus_set_is_master(0,0);
00105 
00106         //Timer used for the communication bus. The interrupt is caught in bus.c
00107         init_timer_2(); 
00108         
00109         //Timer with interrupts each ms
00110         init_timer_0();
00111         
00112         device_id = DEVICE_ID_GENERAL_IO;
00113         
00114         sei();
00115 
00116         unsigned char device_count = bus_get_device_count();
00117 
00118         while(1) {
00119                 if (!rx_queue_is_empty()) {
00120                         bus_parse_message();
00121                 }
00122 
00123                 if (!tx_queue_is_empty())
00124                         bus_check_tx_status();
00125                         
00126                 //If this device should act as master it should send out a SYNC command
00127                 //and also the number of devices (for the time slots) that are active on the bus
00128                 if (bus_is_master()) {
00129                         if (counter_sync >= BUS_MASTER_SYNC_INTERVAL) {
00130                                 bus_add_tx_message(bus_get_address(), BUS_BROADCAST_ADDR, 0, BUS_CMD_SYNC, 1, &device_count);
00131                                 counter_sync = 0;
00132                         }
00133                 }
00134 
00135                 if (bus_allowed_to_send()) {
00136                         //Check if a ping message should be sent out on the bus
00137                         if (counter_ping_interval >= BUS_DEVICE_STATUS_MESSAGE_INTERVAL) {
00138                                 //Check if the device is a POS or NEG driver module
00139                                 bus_add_tx_message(bus_get_address(), BUS_BROADCAST_ADDR, 0, BUS_CMD_PING, 1, &device_id);
00140 
00141                                 counter_ping_interval = 0;
00142                         }
00143                 }
00144         }
00145         
00146         return (0);
00147 }
00148 
00150 ISR(SIG_OUTPUT_COMPARE0) {
00151         counter_sync++;
00152         counter_ping_interval++;
00153         counter_compare0++;
00154         
00155         bus_ping_tick();
00156 }
